# typescript/array-type <Badge type="info" text="Style" />

<div class="rule-meta">
<Alert class="fix" type="info">
<span class="emoji">üõ†Ô∏è</span> An auto-fix is available for this rule.
</Alert>
</div>

### What it does

Require consistently using either `T[]` or `Array<T>` for arrays.

### Why is this bad?

Using the `Array` type directly is not idiomatic. Instead, use the array type `T[]` or `Array<T>`.

### Example

```typescript
const arr: Array<number> = new Array<number>();
const arr: number[] = new Array<number>();
```
